docTitle.titlePart:
UCECOAT Â® Waterborne UV Resins
for Field Applied Wood Floor Finishes

front.div:
UCECOAT waterborne UV resins are recommended for use in field applied wood topcoats. The low
viscosity of UCECOAT resins, obtained without the use of low molecular weight acrylate diluents,
provides ease of application in the field with minimal coating penetration into the substrate.
UCECOAT resins that are tack-free before cure are typically used to avoid dust pick-up and/or
damage to uncured coatings.
The choice of UCECOAT waterborne UV resin is based on the desired final coating properties.
Toughness, flexibility, chemical resistance, hardness, abrasion resistance, cure speed, and adhesion
are some of those properties that can be provided. Tables 1 and 2 provide information on the
UCECOAT resins that are recommended for use in field applied wood floor finishes. General
starting point formulations for field applied gloss and matte wood topcoats are given in Tables 3 and
4. The performance properties of the gloss and matte coatings are shown in Table 5. The gloss
finish was prepared by applying two coats of waterbased sealer to oak, followed by one coat of UV
curable topcoat. All coatings were lightly sanded before recoating. The matte finishes were prepared
as follows:
1. Sand the wood panel with P240 sandpaper.
2. Apply first coat at 90 microns (3.6 mils) wet, and air dry to < 6% moisture content.
3. Apply second coat at 55 microns (2.2 mils) wet, air dry to < 6% moisture content, and cure at
25 fpm (400-500 mJ/cm
